cyclone.name: BETA
cyclone.current_location: about 220 miles SE of Galveston, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to drift west-north-west today, approach the mid-upper Texas coast Monday night, then turn slowly north and move across eastern Texas into central Louisiana by mid-week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: mid/upper Texas coast between Port Aransas and High Island

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch south of Port Aransas TX to the Mouth of the Rio Grande
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning Port Aransas TX to Morgan City LA; Storm Surge Warning Port Aransas TX to Rockefeller Wildlife Refuge LA
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Texas coast from Port Aransas to High Island and much of southern Louisiana coast including Vermilion, Calcasieu, Sabine, Lake Borgne and Lake Pontchartrain shorelines
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds are unlikely (≤8% chance of 34-kt winds) – breezy conditions possible Tuesday–Thursday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 1–3 ft of surge possible in Lake Borgne, Lake Pontchartrain and connected waterways as long-period easterly fetch pushes water toward the south-shore levees.
weather_observation.rainfall: 8–12 in. of rain with locally higher amounts possible across southern Louisiana, producing flash and urban flooding in the New Orleans area Tuesday through Thursday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents along south-facing beaches of southeast Louisiana; minor river rises possible in the Mississippi and Pearl basins.
